value.title: Best kept SECRET in Power BI??? You tell us!
value.excerpt: Have we found the best kept SECRET in Power BI? Adam saw this recently and was BLOWN away! Zooming in can help with presenting in business settings and anywhere else. Here are a few things you can use to make that presentation better with Power BI.  ZoomIt:  https://docs.microsoft.com/sysinternals/downloads/zoomit

value.title: Copy Conditional Columns in Power Query or Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam looks at how to use conditional columns within Power Query and then copying them for use in other queries or Power BI Desktop files. This is a great technique if you don't want to retype all of the conditional items in the dialog in Power BI.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com

value.title: Download PBIX reports - Minute Monday
value.excerpt: In this video, I show you how you can download a PBIX (Power BI Desktop file) from the Power BI service for a given report. Reports have to have been published after November 24. 2016 for the feature to be available. This does work with Live or DirectQuery reports.  Ginger Grant's Blog talking about

value.title: INSANE AMAZING updates for the Power BI Embedded Playground (2021)

Then you need to check out the INSANE AMAZING updates for the Power BI Embedded Playground! Amit Shuster walks us through the revamp. value.title: Inside Power Query reference queries for Power BI and Excel
value.excerpt: Chris Webb joins Patrick to look at what happens when you use reference queries for Power Query. This applies to both Power BI and Excel. value.title: Power BI Desktop And Role-Playing Dimensions: Can you do it?

value.title: Power BI Drillthrough Updates
value.excerpt: Did you know there were Power BI drillthrough updates? In this video, Patrick looks at the drillthrough updates in Power BI Desktop. This includes Keep All Filters which will pass the filters on your parent page to the drillthrough page.   LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube

value.title: Power BI for report consumers and end users (2021)
value.excerpt: In this video, we look at Power BI for report consumers, or end users. Those folks that maybe don't author reports, but just view reports within Power BI. We introduce some basic Power BI concepts and introduce you to areas of the Power BI service to get you familiar with the portal.  📢 Become a member:

value.title: STOP refreshing a single table at a time! (Power BI Desktop)
value.excerpt: Stop refreshing one table at a time! Also, don't wait for the entire data model to finish refreshing. Refresh multiple tables within Power BI Desktop. value.title: The Power BI Smart Narrative visual is INSANE AMAZING!
value.excerpt: The smart narrative visual can help tell the story in your Power BI report. Justyna Lucznik joins us to explore the visual and to illustrate how you can generate text about your data.  Make sure you have the September 2020 version of Power BI Desktop, or later.  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/visuals/power-bi-visualization-smart-narrative

value.title: Visualize Graph Data in Power BI
value.excerpt: Have you wondered how to visualize graph data? No, not Microsoft Graph. Graph Networks! Adam shows you how you can do this in Power BI Desktop.  Download sample: http://guyinacu.be/graphdatasample  Microsoft Graph API: https://docs.microsoft.com/graph/overview  Graphs and Networks https://www.mathworks.com/help/matlab/graph-and-network-algorithms.html

value.title: What the heck is USERPRINCIPALNAME in Power BI? (Row-Level Security)
value.excerpt: Ever wonder what USERPRINCIPALNAME is in DAX within Power BI? Or the difference between USERPRINCIPALNAME and USERNAME? Hint - It's used with Row-Level Security.  New Row-Level Security course from Guy in a Cube - https://guyinacu.be/courses  📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************

value.title: DAX Measures: Filter Context Explained in Simple Terms using the I.C.A.N. Principle
value.excerpt: For Power BI DAX Measures, one of the hardest concepts to grasp is the Filter Context. Or is it? I explain the “Filter Context” using the 4-easy step approach of the I.C.A.N. Principle. ==  I. Incoming Filters ==  C. CALCULATE does it’s Magic! ==  A. Apply relationships (filters flow Across relationships)
